column4: AirBnB picks Ireland for European headquarters

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 13 U.S. stocks rose on Friday and the Dow registered its best weekly gain since January  helped by a rise in Intel shares  though trading was subdued ahead of the Federal Reserve's expected reduction of stimulus measures next week.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St ends up; Dow posts best weekly gain since Jan
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 13 U.S. stocks rose on Friday and the Dow registered its best weekly gain since January  helped by gains in Intel  though trading was subdued as the Federal Reserve is expected to scale back its stimulus measures next week.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 13 U.S. stocks edged higher on Friday  with the S&P 500 set to post its largest weekly gain in two months  with traders focusing on next week's U.S. Federal Reserve meeting and its expected reduction of stimulus.

column4: UPDATE 1-Market Chatter-Corporate finance press digest
column5: Sept 13 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media on Friday:

column4: Pimco  BlackRock  buy chunks of Verizon's record bond deal: report
column5: Leading bond-fund managers Pacific Investment Management Co. and BlackRock Inc  bought about $13 billion of the debt Verizon Communications Inc  sold in its record $49 billion bond offering  the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Pimco  BlackRock  buy chunks of Verizon's record bond deal - report
column5: Sept 12 Leading bond-fund managers Pacific Investment Management Co. and BlackRock Inc bought about $13 billion of the debt Verizon Communications Inc sold in its record $49 billion bond offering  the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Lufthansa close to Airbus  Boeing jet order: sources
column5: PARIS/FRANKFURT Lufthansa  is close to placing an order  split between Airbus  and Boeing   for dozens of long-haul jets  two people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Lufthansa close to Airbus  Boeing jet order -sources
column5: * Split deal follows competition for around 50 long-haul jets

column4: Lufthansa close to Airbus  Boeing jet order -sources
column5: PARIS/FRANKFURT  Sept 13 Germany's Lufthansa  is close to placing an order shared between Airbus  and Boeing for dozens of long-haul jets  two people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

column4: Chevron signs Brazil oil-spill accord  may end lawsuits
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Sept 13 Chevron Corp  the No. 2 U.S. oil company  signed an accord on Friday that could lead to the end of civil lawsuits seeking $17.5 billion in damages for a November 2011 oil spill  the company's lawyer in Brazil  Oscar Couto  said.

column4: Chevron's Frade field in Brazil producing up to 16 000 bpd
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Sept 13 U.S. oil company Chevron  is producing 15 000 to 16 000 barrels per day of crude on average from its Brazilian offshore Frade oil field northeast of Rio de Janeiro  where the company spilled 3 600 barrels of oil into the sea after a 2011 accident  Rafael Jean Williamson  the company's director of corporate affairs in Brazil  said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Chilean brewer CCU places shares in oversubscribed sale
column5: SANTIAGO  Sept 13 Chilean bottler and brewer Compania Cervecerias Unidas (CCU) said on Friday it successfully placed the first slice of its rights offer  which was more than five times oversubscribed.

column4: Chile's CCU prices rights offer at 6 500 pesos
column5: SANTIAGO  Sept 13 Chilean bottler and brewer Compania Cervecerias Unidas (CCU) has priced its rights offering at 6 500 pesos  it said on Friday  as it aims to raise about $660 million to expand.

column4: DB defends credit shake-up in face of staunch criticism
column5: * Splits credit  rates sales but keeps trading integrated

column4: Embraer says strong fourth quarter to put it on track for 2013 goal
column5: SAO JOSE DOS CAMPOS  Brazil A large number of deliveries of regional E-Jets aircraft in the fourth quarter should help Brazil's Embraer SA  meet its 2013 goal  a senior executive of the company  the world's third-largest commercial planemaker  said on Friday.

column4: Entergy may have to shut NY Indian Point reactors by 2018 -analyst
column5: Sept 13 New York state environmental regulations may force Entergy Corp to shut its Indian Point nuclear power plant by 2018  according to a research report by U.S. financial firm Morgan Stanley.

column4: Ford's U.S. sales chief retires; new COO in Europe named
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co  on Friday announced that its U.S. sales and marketing chief  Ken Czubay  will retire and that Barb Samardzich has been promoted to chief operating officer in Europe from product development chief in the region.

column4: Ford's U.S. sales chief retires; new COO in Europe named
column5: DETROIT  Sept 13 Ford Motor Co on Friday announced that its U.S. sales and marketing chief  Ken Czubay  will retire and that Barb Samardzich has been promoted to chief operating officer in Europe from product development chief in the region.

KGaA's (FMC; together Fresenius)  Long-term Issuer Default Ratings (IDR)  senior secured and senior unsecured  ratings on Rating Watch Evolving (RWE). FSE and FMC's Short-term IDRs and FSE's  commercial paper programme rating have been placed on Rating Watch Positive  (RWP). The rating actions follow the announcemen

column5: Sept 13 Bill Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management cut its stake in mall owner General Growth Properties Inc to 3.7 percent from 8 percent  the hedge fund said in a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

column4: U.S. puts conditions on Honeywell's Intermec purchase
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. authorities on Friday cleared Honeywell International's proposed purchase of mobile computing device maker Intermec on the condition that Honeywell license to a competitor certain key patents used in barcode scanners.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. puts conditions on Honeywell's Intermec purchase
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 13 U.S. authorities on Friday cleared Honeywell International's   proposed purchase of mobile computing device maker Intermec on the condition that Honeywell license to a competitor certain key patents used in barcode scanners.

column4: U.S. regulator puts conditions on Honeywell's Intermec purchase
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 13 U.S. authorities on Friday cleared Honeywell International's   proposed purchase of mobile computing device maker Intermec on the condition that Honeywell license key patents used to make scanners.

column4: Passive fund manager Vanguard turns activist in some board votes
column5: Sept 13 Fund manager Vanguard Group Inc opposed the election of board members in a number of high-profile proxy contests this year  votes that help explain why directors at firms such as Hewlett-Packard Co and Occidental Petroleum Corp had a hard time getting re-elected.

column4: Insight: Trigger finger - Apple fires biometrics into the mainstream
column5: SINGAPORE/SAN FRANCISCO By adding a fingerprint scanner to its newest mobile phone  Apple Inc is offering a tantalizing glimpse of a future where your favorite gadget might become a biometric pass to the workplace  mobile commerce or real-world shopping and events.

column4: INSIGHT-Trigger finger: Apple fires biometrics into the mainstream
column5: * Fingerprint security offers comfort for commerce  enterprises

column4: India lures chip makers  says IBM and STMicro interested
column5: NEW DELHI/BANGALORE Two consortiums  including IBM and STMicroelectronics  have proposed building semiconductor wafer plants in India costing a total of $8 billion  a minister said after the government approved concessions to lure chipmakers.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 1-India lures chip makers  says IBM and STMicro interested
column5: NEW DELHI/BANGALORE  Sept 13 Two consortiums  including IBM and STMicroelectronics  have proposed building semiconductor wafer plants in India costing a total of $8 billion  a minister said after the government approved concessions to lure chipmakers.

column4: India says consortia including IBM propose to build chip foundries
column5: NEW DELHI  Sept 13 Two consortia have proposed to build semiconductor wafer fabrication units in India  the Minister for Communication and Information Technology  Kapil Sibal  told reporters in New Delhi on Friday.

column5: * JPMorgan  Bank of America  Wells Fargo expected to release reserves

column4: JPMorgan to spend $4 billion on compliance and risk controls: WSJ
column5: NEW YORK JPMorgan Chase & Co  plans to spend an additional $4 billion and commit 5 000 extra employees to fix risk and compliance issues after a slew of investigations by regulatory authorities  the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-JPMorgan to spend $4 bln on compliance and risk controls-WSJ
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 12 JPMorgan Chase & Co  plans to spend an additional $4 billion and commit 5 000 extra employees to fix risk and compliance issues after a slew of investigations by regulatory authorities  the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

column2: JC Penney Company Inc Holding Company
column4: Vornado's chairman  Roth  resigns from Penney board -filing
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 13 Vornado Realty Trust  Chairman and Chief Executive Steven Roth resigned on Friday from the board of department store chain J.C. Penney Co Inc  the company said in a regulatory filing.

column4: KKR  New Mountain pursue joint bid for talent agency IMG -sources
column5: Private equity firm KKR & Co LP  has teamed up with New Mountain Capital LLC to bid for IMG  joining a handful of companies interested in buying the sports  fashion and marketing agency from Forstmann Little & Co  two people familiar with the matter said.

column4: CORRECTED-KKR  New Mountain pursue joint bid for talent agency IMG -sources
column5: (Corrects spelling of Forstmann in paragraphs three and four)

column4: KKR sells its stake in Danish telecoms firm TDC for $744 million
column5: COPENHAGEN/LONDON Private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co (KKR)  has sold its 11 percent stake in Danish telecoms firm TDC  for $744 million  taking advantage of a recent surge in telecoms stocks to make a long-expected exit from the business.

column4: UPDATE 1-KKR sells its stake in Danish telecoms firm TDC for $744 mln
column5: * Sold at 46.3 DKK a share  small discount to Thur's close

column4: UPDATE 1-KKR mulls teaming with Japan state fund on Panasonic unit stake-media
column5: TOKYO  Sept 13 KKR & Co LP is considering teaming up with a state-backed Japanese investment fund to secure a stake in Panasonic Corp's healthcare business  media reported  although people familiar with the matter said the U.S. firm has not approached the fund yet.

column4: Lockheed Martin wins rare commercial contract for Atlas launch
column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Florida Lockheed Martin Corp  has won a rare commercial contract for launch services on its unmanned Atlas 5 rocket  officials said on Thursday.

column4: CORRECTED-Lockheed Martin wins rare commercial contract for Atlas launch
column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla.  Sept 12 Lockheed Martin Corp has won a rare commercial contract for launch services on its unmanned Atlas 5 rocket  officials said on Thursday.

column4: McCain to parry Putin N.Y. Times op-ed with one for Pravda
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. Senator John McCain will submit an opinion piece to the Russian newspaper Pravda in response to an op-ed on Syria in The New York Times by Russian President Vladimir Putin that infuriated many members of Congress  a spokesman said on Friday.

column4: Cost of flying Northrop's Global Hawk down over 50 percent: sources
column5: WASHINGTON The cost of flying Northrop Grumman Corp's  RQ-4 Global Hawk unmanned spy plane has dropped more than 50 percent over the past three years  reflecting higher use and efforts to lower operating costs  a source familiar with the program said.

column4: Cost of flying Northrop's Global Hawk down over 50 pct-sources
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 13 The cost of flying Northrop Grumman Corp's RQ-4 Global Hawk unmanned spy plane has dropped more than 50 percent over the past three years  reflecting higher use and efforts to lower operating costs  a source familiar with the program said.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Sept 13 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Friday:

column4: Passive fund manager Vanguard turns activist in some board votes
column5: Sept 13 Fund manager Vanguard Group Inc opposed the election of board members in a number of high-profile proxy contests this year  votes that help explain why directors at firms such as Hewlett-Packard Co and Occidental Petroleum Corp had a hard time getting re-elected.

column4: Occidental seeks buyers for 40 percent of Middle East unit: report
column5: Occidental Petroleum Corp  is looking to sell 40 percent of its Middle East operations for $8 billion  Bloomberg reported on Friday  as Oxy seeks investment in the unit as part of a broader plan to split up the company.

column4: Man  Och-Ziff among hedge funds to get China quota for investment overseas - report
column5: SHANGHAI  Sept 13 China has granted six foreign hedge fund management companies quotas to raise yuan in China and invest it abroad  the 21st Century Business Herald reported  citing an unidentified source with knowledge of the decision.

column4: Sailing-Oracle losing grasp on America's Cup as Kiwis win sixth
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Oracle Team USA's bid to turn the tide in its floundering America's Cup campaign by bringing sailing superstar Ben Ainslie aboard failed on Thursday  when Emirates Team New Zealand crushed the defenders in two do-or-die races.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Sailing-Oracle losing grasp on America's Cup as Kiwis win sixth
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  September 12 Oracle Team USA's bid to turn the tide in its floundering America's Cup campaign by bringing sailing superstar Ben Ainslie aboard failed on Thursday  when Emirates Team New Zealand crushed the defenders in two do-or-die races.

column4: Peabody says it no longer owes benefits to Patriot retirees
column5: Peabody Energy Corp   the company responsible for creating now-bankrupt Patriot Coal  through a 2007 spinoff  on Friday said it has no obligation to fund health and pension benefits for Patriot retirees affected by the company's insolvency.

column4: Peabody says it no longer owes benefits to Patriot retirees
column5: Sept 13 Peabody Energy Corp  the company responsible for creating now-bankrupt Patriot Coal  through a 2007 spinoff  on Friday said it has no obligation to fund health and pension benefits for Patriot retirees affected by the company's insolvency.

column4: Petrobras sells Colombian pipelines  blocks to Perenco for $380 mln
column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 13 Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras said its board had approved the sale of its Colombian oil pipelines and some of its onshore oil blocks to Perenco for $380 million.

column4: ONGC  Shell to pre-empt Petrobras oil block stake sale to Sinochem: sources
column5: NEW DELHI Royal Dutch Shell  and India's ONGC  plan to exercise their pre-emption rights to buy a 35 percent stake in a Brazilian oil block that Brazil's Petrobras had planned to sell to China's Sinochem Group  two sources said.

column4: ONGC  Shell to pre-empt Petrobras oil block stake sale to Sinochem-sources
column5: * ONGC to buy 10-15 pct share of Petrobras  Shell to acquire remainder

column4: PNC Chairman Rohr to leave BlackRock board: filing
column5: PNC Financial Services Group Inc  Executive Chairman James Rohr will not be seeking re-election to the board of New York-based asset manager BlackRock  next year  the company said in a regulatory filing on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-PNC Chairman Rohr to leave BlackRock board-filing
column5: Sept 13 PNC Financial Services Group Inc  Executive Chairman James Rohr will not be seeking re-election to the board of New York-based asset manager BlackRock next year  the company said in a regulatory filing on Friday.

column5: Sept 13 PNC Financial Services Group Inc  Executive Chairman James Rohr will not be seeking re-election to the board of New York-based asset manager BlackRock next year  the company said in a regulatory filing on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-General Electric names PNC chairman to board of directors
column5: Sept 13 General Electric Co named PNC Financial Services Group Chairman James Rohr to its board of directors on Friday.

column4: General Electric names PNC chairman to board of directors
column5: Sept 13 General Electric Co named PNC Financial Services Group Chairman James Rohr to its board of directors on Friday.

column4: Hyundai Steel fires up 3rd blast furnace amid fears of over-supply
column5: DANGJIN  South Korea  Sept 13 South Korea's Hyundai Steel fired up its third blast furnace on Friday as it seeks to grasp market share from POSCO  and Japan in the alloy used to make cars and ships  sparking fears about over-supply amid weak demand.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX ekes out gain on Potash Corp jump; drops on week
column5: * TSX rises 22.35 points  or 0.18 percent  at 12 723.40     * Six of the 10 main index sectors close higher     * Index fell 0.76 percent on the week      By Alastair Sharp     TORONTO  Sept 13 Canada's main stock index closed slightly higher on Friday  helped by a sharp jump in shares of fertilizer producer Potash Corp  but the gain was limited by a fall in heavily-weighted banks after data showed Canadians are more indebted than ever.     Potash Corp jumped 2.3 percent to C$33.57 a

column4: UPDATE 2-Kerimov selling $3.7 bln Uralkali stake to Russian banker-reports
column5: * Reported buyer Kogan dubbed "Putin's banker" by Russian media

column4: Fitch Affirms RGA's Ratings; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  September 13 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Reinsurance Group of  America  Inc.'s (RGA) 'A-' Issuer Default Rating (IDR)  and the 'A+' Insurer  Financial Strength (IFS) rating of RGA Reinsurance Company (RGA Reinsurance).  The Rating Outlook for all ratings is Stable. A complete list of ratings follows  at the end of this release.  Key Rating Drivers RGA maintains leading positions in its core markets: U.S. and Canadian or

column4: Sanofi could acquire L'Oreal's stake  buy more of Regeneron
column5: PARIS/LONDON Repurchasing L'Oreal's 9 percent stake in Sanofi might make sense for the French drugmaker if the $12 billion holding is put up for sale  Sanofi's chief executive said on Friday.

column4: ViroPharma attracted interest from Sanofi  Shire: report
column5: ViroPharma Inc   a drug maker that specializes in rare diseases  has attracted interest from Sanofi SA  and Shire PLC   Bloomberg reported on Friday  pushing shares of the company up 24 percent.

column4: Sanofi says might make sense to buy back L'Oreal's $12 bln stake
column5: PARIS/LONDON  Sept 13 Repurchasing L'Oreal's  9 percent stake in Sanofi might make sense for the French drugmaker if the $12 billion holding is put up for sale  Sanofi's chief executive said on Friday.

column4: HIGHLIGHTS-Statoil reveals chronic weakness in Algeria security
column5: Sept 13 Statoil missed warning signs and failed to prepare for an incident like January's deadly attack at an Algerian gas plant  an internal company probe said  painting a picture of chronic security problems at the site.

column4: After Algeria attack  Statoil sets up risk unit
column5: LONDON  Sept 12 Norway's Statoil is setting up a political and security risk analysis team to protect employees and assets in global hotspots after failing to foresee a deadly attack in Algeria earlier this year  company officials said.

column4: Telecom Italia says board member probed for insider trading quits
column5: MILAN  Sept 13 Telecom Italia's  independent board member Elio Catania  who is being investigated for alleged insider trading  resigned on Friday  the company said.

column4: Blackstone-led buyout group makes lower bid for Pactera
column5: China's largest technology outsourcing company  Pactera Technology International Ltd  said Blackstone Group LP and the company's management reduced their offer to take the company private  citing its weakening financial performance.

column4: UPDATE 1-Blackstone-led buyout group makes lower bid for Pactera
column5: * Group cuts offer to take company private to $7.00/ADS from $7.50

column4: Blackstone-led buyout group makes lower bid for Pactera
column5: Sept 13 China's largest technology outsourcing company  Pactera Technology International Ltd  said it received a lower offer to be taken private by Blackstone Group LP and the company's management.

column4: TransCanada settles gas distribution dispute in eastern Canada
column5: Sept 13 Pipeline company TransCanada Corp  said it had reached a distribution agreement with gas companies in Ontario and Quebec  that ends disputes over tolls and allows for increased supplies.

column5: Sept 13 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media on Friday:

column4: Pimco  BlackRock  buy chunks of Verizon's record bond deal: report
column5: Leading bond-fund managers Pacific Investment Management Co. and BlackRock Inc  bought about $13 billion of the debt Verizon Communications Inc  sold in its record $49 billion bond offering  the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: U.S. judge hears chorus of complaints over $7.2 billion credit card pact
column5: NEW YORK A U.S. federal judge on Thursday heard a diverse parade of objectors seeking to derail a record $7.2 billion class action settlement he is weighing between merchants and credit companies Visa Inc and MasterCard Inc over credit card fees.

column4: Vornado's chairman  Roth  resigns from J.C. Penney board
column5: NEW YORK Vornado Realty Trust  Chairman and Chief Executive Steven Roth resigned on Friday from the board of department store chain J.C. Penney Co Inc   the company said in a regulatory filing.

column4: Vornado's chairman  Roth  resigns from Penney board -filing
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 13 Vornado Realty Trust  Chairman and Chief Executive Steven Roth resigned on Friday from the board of department store chain J.C. Penney Co Inc  the company said in a regulatory filing.

column4: Imperial Oil CEO says Kearl project producing more than 80 000 bpd
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Sept 13 Current production rates at Imperial Oil Ltd's Kearl oil sands project in northern Alberta are in excess of 80 000 barrel per day  Chief Executive Rich Kruger told a conference on Friday.
